articles.content:
Greetings to President of Yemen 
    Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Ali Abdullah Saleh, president of Yemen, on September 25 on the occasion of the 41st anniversary of the revolutionary day of Yemen.
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop in the future, too, and wished the president greater success in his work for the prosperity of the country as well as good health and happiness.

articles.content:
Agreement on Friendly Relations Signed between DPRK and Laos 
    Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The 2004-2008 agreement on developing the friendly and cooperative relations and exchange between the DPRK and Laos was signed in Vientiane, Laos, on Sept. 23.
 Present at the signing ceremony were members of the DPRK friendship delegation led by Mun Jae Chol, chairman of the DPRK-Laos Friendship Association who is acting chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and the DPRK ambassador to Laos from the DPRK side and the chairman of the Lao Federation of Trade Unions who is also chairman of the Laos-Korea Friendship Association and officials concerned from the opposite side.

articles.title: Reception Given on PRC Anniversary
South and Overseas Delegations here
Congratulations to Syrian Prime Minister
articles.content:
South and Overseas Delegations here 
    Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The south side's delegation headed by Jon Jae Jin, chairman of the Society for Probing the Truth behind the Sinking of Ship Ukishima by Explosion and the overseas delegation led by Hong Sang Jin, secretary general of the Central Headquarters of the Korean Side of the Fact-finding Group of the Forcible Drafting of Koreans arrived here on Sept. 27 to participate in the Pyongyang symposium for probing the truth behind the "Ukishima-Maru" incident.
 Also arriving was Japanese delegate Yuka Anjako.    
 They were greeted at the airport by Hong Son Ok, chairperson of the DPRK Measure Committee for Demanding Compensation to Comfort Women for the Japanese Army and Victims of Forcible Drafting, and other officials concerned.

articles.title: Congratulations to Syrian Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Congratulations to Syrian Prime Minister 
    Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju sent a message to Muhamad Naji Otri, congratulating him on his appointment as Syrian prime minister.
 Expressing the belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to expand and develop, the message wished him success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Cause of WPK and Korean People Supported
articles.content:
Congratulations to Syrian Foreign Minister
    Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a congratulatory message to Farouk Al Shara on his reappointment as Syrian foreign minister.
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to grow strong in the interests of the peoples of the two countries, and wished him greater success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Additional Troop Dispatch to Iraq Rejected
17th Seminar on Yun I Sang Music Held
articles.content:
Additional Troop Dispatch to Iraq Rejected
    Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- Six members of the group for peace against war in Iraq and medical supporters team called a press conference in Seoul on September 24 upon their return home from Iraq. There they strongly opposed the additional troop dispatch to Iraq, according to CBS.
 With nothing can one justify hurling youngsters as bullet shields of the U.S., they said, contending that if it is in the interests of the state to drop bombs on Iraqi children, we do not want to meet such interests.
